oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Radio report on new Country Music Hall of Fame - various interviews - 2000-02-08 - WPLN
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of a radio report on the new Country Hall of Fame museum building, featuring interviews with John Madole, Seab Tuck, Chris Miceli, and Kyle Young on February 8, 2000 on radio station WPLN (Nashville, Tenn,). Recording also contains an interview with Chris Isaak, conducted by Paul Kingsbury on November 24, 1998.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Test tones -- (01:11) Marjorie Outlaw talks about the beginning of construction for the new Country Music Hall of Fame, and introduces John Madole -- (01:30) Madole talks about construction plans for the museum -- (02:05) Seab Tuck talks about what the architecture and interior will represent in country music -- Marjorie Outlaw talks about the rotunda and the radio tower that will be above it -- (03:20) Tuck talks about involving "Will The Circle Be Unbroken" within the architecture -- (03:55) Chris Miceli talks about the exhibit design of the new space, involving the experience of country music as a whole as evidence of an era -- Miceli talks about various artifacts that will be on display -- (5:39) Kyle Young talks about the new museum space, pricing out at 37 million dollars -- Marjorie Outlaw concludes the report -- [break] -- Paul Kingsbury introduces Chris Isaak -- (06:35) Isaak talks about this being the first time at the CMHoF and how much he likes it -- (07:20) Isaak talks about growing up in California, try to watch country music programs as much a possible -- (07:50) Isaak talks about his favorite artists being Hank Snow, Lefty Frizzell, Floyd Tillman, Johnny Cash, Jerry Lee, the Everly Brothers and Stonewall Jackson -- (08:40) Isaak talks about sounding like and being influence by Roy Orbison -- (09:35) Isaak talks about always including credits on record labels -- (10:20) Isaak talks about meeting Stonewall Jackson and how he has a strong voice -- (10:35) Isaak talks about playing at the Ryman later that night for the first time -- (11:45) Isaak talks about playing at the Bluebird Cafe in the past, and getting pulled over after the show -- (12:40) Isaak does a tagline for the Country Music Hall of Fame and concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.); Tuck, Seab; Young, Kyle; Isaak, Chris; Kingsbury, Paul;
